result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas R. Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas R. Thompson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas R. Thompson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Fine and costs must be paid within 60 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas R. Thompson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bond Paperwork from posting in Columbia County
Commitment amount posted in Columbia County

Defendant Nicholas R. Thompson in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that he met with the defendant this morning for a pre-trial conference and an offer was provided.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Defendant agrees.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
Defendant enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation. Atty Hendee states that the defendant is on a probation hold from Dane County.  Defendant is aware of the probation hold.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Court orders 30 days in the Marquette County Jail; consecutive to any other sentence
Credit = 24 days
Time Served
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Defendant does not agree to the $15 payment plan fee.  Fine and costs to be paid within 60 days.
Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Pre-trial conference on December 13, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Return date on December 22, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Nicholas R. Thompson in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
 Court confirms the defendant's address.  Defendant states that he does not have a mailing address at this time as he is homeless.  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  Atty Hendee requests a $250 cash bond with conditions.  Defendant states that he cannot pay the bond; he just quit his job and has a hearing tomorrow in Columbia County.
  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250 Cash bond with conditions:
*Absolute Sobiety; zero tolerance

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.  Court finds waiver of Attorney made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and Pre-Trial  Return date scheduled for December 22, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 13, 2016 at 09:30 am.
